* Main class for the Pepe application, a command-line task manager.
* This class initializes the application, loads tasks from storage,
* handles user input through the Ui, and executes commands using the Parser.
* Constructs a new Pepe application instance with the given storage file path.
* Loads tasks from the storage file. If loading fails, initializes an empty TaskList.
* @param filePath the path to the storage file for tasks
* Runs the main loop of the Pepe application.
* The loop repeatedly reads user commands, parses them, executes the
* corresponding command, and updates the task list until the user exits.
* Entry point for the Pepe application.
* Initializes a Pepe instance with the default task storage path and runs the main loop.

* Abstract class representing a command in Pepe.
* Each concrete command (e.g., TodoCommand, MarkCommand) must implement the execute method.
* Commands can optionally signal the application to exit by overriding isExit().
* @param ui      the UI for displaying messages
* @param storage the Storage for saving or loading tasks
* @throws PepeExceptions if an error occurs during command execution
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws PepeExceptions;
* Indicates whether this command signals the application to exit.
* @return true if the application should exit after this command, false otherwise
* Command to add a {@link pepe.task.Deadlines} task to the task list.
* Extends the {@link Command} abstract class and implements the {@link #execute(TaskList, Ui, Storage)}

* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the specified task.

* @param storage the storage object to save the updated task list

* Parser class for converting user input strings into executable Commands.
* It uses regular expressions to identify the type of command and extracts
* necessary arguments for task creation or manipulation.
private static final Pattern TODO_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^todo\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern DEADLINE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^deadline\\s+(.+)\\s+/by\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern EVENT_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^event\\s+(.+)\\s+/from\\s+(.+)\\s+/to\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern MARK_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^mark\\s+(\\d+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern UNMARK_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^unmark\\s+(\\d+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern DELETE_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^delete\\s+(\\d+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
private static final Pattern FIND_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("^find\\s+(.+)$", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
* Parses a user input string and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param input the raw input string from the user
* @return a Command object representing the action to be executed
* @throws PepeExceptions if the input does not match any valid command format

* @param name     the name or description of the task
* @param dateline the due date in the format yyyy-MM-dd

public Deadlines(String name, String dateline) throws PepeExceptions {

* Checks if the deadline is within the next week.
* @return true if the deadline is today or within the next 7 days, false otherwise
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task for display.
* Format: [D][X] taskName (by: MMM d yyyy) if marked, [D][ ] taskName (by: MMM d yyyy) if unmarked.
* @return a human-readable string representing the Deadline task
* Returns a string representing the Deadline task in a file-friendly format.
* Format: D | 1 | taskName | MMM d yyyy (if marked) or D | 0 | taskName | MMM d yyyy (if unmarked)
* @return the Deadline task formatted for saving to a file
* An Event task has a name, a marked status, a start date, and an end date.
* The end date cannot be before today, and the start date cannot be after the end date.
* Constructs a new Event task with the given name, start date, and end date.
* @param name      the name or description of the task
* @param startTime the start date in the format yyyy-MM-dd
* @param endTime   the end date in the format yyyy-MM-dd
* @throws PepeExceptions if the dates are invalid (format, end before today, or start after end)
public Events(String name, String startTime, String endTime) throws PepeExceptions {

throw new PepeExceptions("Invalid Input: Start Date cannot be after End Date");

* Checks if the event is due within the next week based on the end date.
* @return true if the end date is within the next 7 days, false otherwise
* Returns a string representation of the Event task for display.
* Format: [E][X] taskName (from: MMM d yyyy to: MMM d yyyy) if marked,
* [E][ ] taskName (from: MMM d yyyy to: MMM d yyyy) if unmarked.
* @return a human-readable string representing the Event task
* Returns a string representing the Event task in a file-friendly format.
* Format: E | 1 | taskName | MMM d yyyy - MMM d yyyy (if marked) or
* E | 0 | taskName | MMM d yyyy - MMM d yyyy (if unmarked)
* @return the Event task formatted for saving to a file
* Each task has a name and a marked status indicating whether it is completed.
* Subclasses must implement specific behavior for due dates and file formatting.
/** The name or description of the task. */
/** Whether the task is marked as done (true) or not (false). */

* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the name of the task.
* Returns an integer representing whether the task is marked.
* @return 1 if the task is marked as done, 0 if unmarked
* Checks if the task is due next week.
* Must be implemented by subclasses to provide task-specific logic.

* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* Format: [X] taskName if marked, [ ] taskName if unmarked.
* @return a human-readable string representing the task
* Returns a string representing the task in a file-friendly format.
* Subclasses must implement this to match the storage file format.
* @return the task formatted for saving to a file

* Format: [T][X] taskName if marked, [T][ ] taskName if unmarked.
* @return a human-readable string representing the ToDo task
* Checks if the ToDo task is due next week.
* Always returns false as ToDo tasks do not have a specific due date.
* Returns a string representing the ToDo task in a file-friendly format.
* Format: T | 1 | taskName (if marked) or T | 0 | taskName (if unmarked)
* @return the ToDo task formatted for saving to a file
